para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Applicable contribution” has the meaning stated in Election Law Article, §14-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Award” means the written notification by a governmental entity announcing that the governmental entity intends to enter into a contract for a procurement.
“Contract” has the meaning stated in Election Law Article, §14-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Doing public business” has the meaning stated in Election Law Article, §14-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Donation” has the meaning stated in Election Law Article, §13-306 or 13-307, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Governmental entity” has the meaning stated in Election Law Article, §14-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
“Independent expenditure entity” means a person required to file an:
Independent expenditure report; or
Electioneering Communication report.
“Political committee affiliated with a candidate” means:
An authorized candidate campaign committee of the candidate;
A slate of which a candidate is a member;
A legislative party caucus committee, excluding the administrative account;

A political party central committee, except for the administrative account, if the contributor knows that the contribution will be used for a coordinated expenditure for the candidate subject to the contribution limits pursuant to Election Law Article, §13-226(c), Annotated Code of Maryland; or
A political action committee whose major purpose is to support or oppose an identified candidate.
“Statement of contributions” means a report that:
Is authorized or required under Election Law Article, Title 14, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Relates to the campaign finance activity of the person doing public business; and
Is filed or submitted on a form prescribed by the State Board.

annotations.annotation: Election Law Article, §§2-102(b)(4) and 14-109, Annotated Code of Maryland
Regulation .01B amended effective February 29, 2016 (43:4 Md. R. 339); September 12, 2016 (43:18 Md. R. 1018)
